page.title: 12Gas Terminal
page.content: { Briscoe Riggs gas terminal}is an offtake of the{National Gas {Transmission Grid,}which is fed by four East Coast Terminals, the most Southerley being at Bacton,Norfolk, Theddlethorpe,Lincs then northwards to Easington N.Humberside on to St.Fergus,North of Aberdeen and a further terminal at Barrow in Furness(taking it's gas from Morecambe Bay) These five terminals together are piped to the main point at Briscoe Rigg and then{syphoned and distributed for the{North Eastern Gas Board's region to approximately{1,000,000 {homes in the Yorkshire area.
